co-founder Larry Page will take over as Google's CEO, while Eric Schmidt will take on the role of executive chairman, the href="http://investor.google.com/earnings/2010/Q4_google_earnings.html" title="company just announced"> company just announced. Google says it's making the changes to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility at the top of the company but there were no signs that anything was amiss at the triumvirate that has led the company since 2001. The news came as part of the company's Q4 href="http://paidcontent.org/article/419-googles-q4-numbers-give-no-hint-at-reason-for-shakeup/" title="earnings results"> earnings results.

plays made by Scottie Pippen in this game. http://wn.com/Allen Iverson_Allen Iverson_Career_High_60pts_vs_the_Dwight Howard_Dwight Howard_Orlando_Magic_04/05 Three-time scoring champ hits career high Allen Iverson gave the crowd an electrifying performance to remember. Then the fans returned the favor with raucous ovations he won't soon forget. That's when you get the goose bumps, Allen Iverson said.`` You honestly don't really feel it when the shots are going down. You don't ever get the goose bumps until the fans start to appreciate what you're doing out there.''

analysts and insiders say, in contrast to Facebook, Twitter and other younger, more agile competitors.'' In what sounds more like a prescriptive suggestion than a question, href="http://www.dailyfinance.com/story/investing/google-executive-reshuffle-investors-Larry Page-Eric Schmidt-brin-ceo/19809705/"> DailyFinance asks: Will Larry Page steer Google back to the spirit of that first founders' letter, plowing revenue into new research projects that might bear fruit five or 10 years from now, pulling down margins in the meantime? Meanwhile, some are suggesting that Eric Schmidt is walking away now because he senses that Google's fortunes have peaked. had a string of 355 passes without being intercepted, received 21 votes from a nationwide panel of 50 media members who regularly cover the league. He easily beat Philadelphia quarterback Michael Vick , who got 11 votes. To me it comes down to the mental toughness and determination of the players and coaches, Tom Brady said. of co-founder as opposed to his current role of president, Technology.`` He's an innovator and entrepreneur to the core, and this role suits him perfectly,'' Eric Schmidt wrote in his post. As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated.
